data.title: DANCE YOUR HEART OUT
data.desc:
“She decided to free herself, Dance into the wind, create a new language. And birds fluttered around her, writing yes in the sky.”

“Great dancers are not great because of their technique; it’s because of their passion.” Do you think you have it in you what it takes to do the locking and popping of be-Boer? Or you consider yourself more of a free styler? It doesn’t matter if you are a jazz dancer or a "Chak De Phatte" Bhangra specialist. Put your dancing shoes and compete in the solo dance competition to prove that you are a connoisseur when it comes to grooving to the beats.
When in doubt, dance your heart out.
YMCA presents Solo and Duo dance competition. All those bitten by the dance bug are cordially invited to relieve themselves. So wear your dancing shoes, let lose your moves and break a jig. 

“Kyunki Tali ek hath se nahi bajti.” 
 Join hands with your partner and make the onlookers join theirs to create the fitting combination of two artists in a single view. Enhance the hotness quotient of the stage and match your steps to become the perfect completing pieces to/of this dancing duo puzzle.
data.rules:
RULES FOR SOLO DANCE: 
1. Only Solo entries allowed. 
2. Participants will be given 3+2 minutes to perform. Participants exceeding this time limit will be penalized. 
3. All dance forms are allowed. 
4. There is restriction on the use of fire or any inflammable object and glass shatter on stage. Negative points may be awarded in such a case. 
5. Participants are required to restore the stage to its initial condition after their performance. 
6. In case of conflicts, judge’s decision would be considered final. 
7. The Participants must bring their songs in a pen drive in MP3 audio format. 

RULES FOR DUO DANCE: 
1. Only Duo entries allowed. 
2. Participants will be given 4+2 minutes to perform. Participants exceeding this time limit will be penalized. 
3. All dance forms are allowed. 
4. There is restriction on the use of fire or any inflammable object and glass shatter on stage. Negative points may be awarded in such a case. 
5. Participants are required to restore the stage to its initial condition after their performance. 
6. In case of conflicts, judges decision would be considered final. 
7. The teams must bring their songs in a pen-drive in mp3 audio format. 

EVALUATION CRITERIA:
The performances will be judged by our panel based on skill, choreography, presence of mind, confidence and stage presence. The result will be declared after all the performances.

data.title: CODE WARS
data.desc: Debugging has always been a frustrating task for all. So.. here we are to 'help' you in the regard. Your task will be to debug the given erroneous code.
data.rules:
1. Each team can have maximum 2 participants.
2. Cross college teams are allowed.
3. Programming Language- C/C++.
4. Minimum changes should be made to the given code.
5. The teams, which debug the code in the minimum time,
 will reach the next round.
6. In case of any dispute, the decision of organisers will be final.

data.title: MAKE A MEME
data.desc: A lit meme can lit your life for quite a time. Ready to join this social cause & make world a better place ;p
data.rules:
1. It is an online pre-fest event.
2. Registrations are compulsory to be able to participate in the event.
3. Too vulgar or disturbing meme will be disqualified.
4. Event will held on www.facebook.com/jhalakcaptus .
5. Likes will be also be a factor for winning.

data.title: CLASH OF DESIGNERS
data.desc:
The main purpose of this designing competition is to inspire and prepare students for career in architecture, engineering and the digital arts.
The challenge offers a great opportunity for students to create some exclusive design projects.
data.rules:
•	It may consist of an individual/team.
•	Competitors will model small objects within a designated time period.

data.title: TECH EXPO
data.desc:
Facilitate and develop the exchange of engineering knowledge and information between engineering personnel and technical specialists.
An opportunity to display their state of the art productsand technologies to the largest gathering.
data.rules: This is a presentation event.

data.title: BOWLING ALLEY
data.desc: A complete bowling alley with all the international standards for an amazing and fantastic game of ten-pin bowling with automatic pin-setters for the purpose of recreation.
data.rules: This is a fun event.

data.title: GHANCHAKKAR
data.desc: It is a fun event. Be ready with your cameras for some fun and excitement. It is an 'on the spot' event. Rounds will be disclosed then and there.
data.rules:
1. 2 members per team.
2. It will have 3 rounds. The round will be disclosed during the event.
3. The team requires to have a basic Phone camera for the event.

data.title: PHOTO GALLERY
data.desc: Brace Yourself! The Photography & designing Club of YMCA is ready to give you eyegasm with their gallery of art. Make your time to watch one of the most creative galleries you’ll ever witness.
data.rules: This is a presentation event.

data.title: PS4 GAMING
data.desc: Looking for something awesome to play today? There are great PS4 games like God of War, Far Cry available right here at Culymca. Be there to get an experience.
data.rules:
This is a fun event.
Duration: 15 minutes

data.title: XUNBAO
data.desc:
To all Lara Crofts and Indiana Jones out there, there is a new treasure in town. Where? It is up to you to find. Hidden in the depths of the Internet, do not lose trail while following or you might get lost forever.
Xunbao is a multi-level contest where you will be given cues to solve.
With every step challenging your wit, it is a race against time and fellows. So get on your Black Pearls, in other words your Mobile and surf the waves on the internet to claim your fame.
This year the stakes could not get any higher. Conquerors of the event will get prizes like Mi Band 2 and more exciting goodies from ocul.in, a simple URL Shortening Service.
To all the smarty pants out there who think they can win by cheating, don\'t even try because every move you make we'll be watching you! 
 GOOD LUCK EXPLORING!
Visit xunbao.elementsculmyca.com
data.rules:
1. Date format is DD/MM/YYY. E.g.- 12/05/2018.
2. 24-hour format is HH/MM/SS. E.g.- 19/45/15.
3. Adoption of wrong means (asking or telling answers to other players, handing over the clue to other players) shall lead to immediate disqualification!

data.title: HACKON
data.desc: Hack On is a prefest hacking and penetration testing contest. With technical clues and cryptographic answers, put yourself in the race.
data.rules: Visit hackon.elementsculmyca.com for rules.

data.title: WYSIWYG CHALLENGE
data.desc:
'What You See Is What You Get' Challenge is one of its kind.
We call all the frontend web developers out there to come and combat in your own desired challenge where you'll have to make a design in pure and vanilla HTML,CSS and JavaScript. "
data.rules:
1. Each team can have maximum 2 participants.
2. Cross-college teams are allowed.
3. Scoring will be based on the similarities and dissimilarities between the mockup and the final output.
4. Cases of plagiarism will lead to direct disqualification. 
5. Bootstrap and other frameworks should not be used.

data.title: MOCK CID 2.0
data.desc: Teams compete to be the first one to solve a crime mystery
data.rules:
1. Each team consists of 5 members each.
2. Teams need to give an aptitude test at the time of registration.
3. Top 8 teams will compete to solve the mystery in the least time.
4. Team Size is 5.

data.title: DRINK PONG
data.desc: One teammate tries to put ping pong balls in glasses to help his teammate drink more and more glasses of cold drink.
data.rules:
1. Each Team gets a time of 1 min.
2. The teammate at the ball throwing end cannot throw the ball until the other one has fully finished the glass of cold drink.
3. Players cannot switch roles once the time has started.

data.title: STACK THE SHUTTLES
data.desc: A teammate tosses shuttle with help of a badminton racket while other catches them to form a stack single-handedly.
data.rules:
1. Each team gets 1 min.
2. Players cannot switch roles once the time has started.

data.title: THUG LIFE 2.0
data.desc: 2 teams of 2 members each compete to transfer max amount of water from one bucket to another using towels.
data.rules: To be declared on the spot.

data.title: COCK FIGHT
data.desc: Players push each other out of the circular area while balancing on one leg.
data.rules:
1. Participants can’t use their hands to push each other.
2. Last man standing on a single leg wins the game.

data.title: HELP ME GET THERE
data.desc:
A duo guides their blindfolded pal to get out of the maze without hitting the obstacles in the least time possible.

A team of 3 is required.
data.rules: To be declared on the spot.

data.title: BEST TRICKER
data.desc: The pal who impresses(the most) the audience and the jury with his/her trick shot video takes away the prize.
data.rules:
1. Video can be of a max of 2 mins.
2. Video may contain multiple trick shots.
3. Shots may be related to any sport.

data.title: DIZZY AIMING
data.desc: The participant tries to aim targets after revolving multiple times around a bat with his/her forehead facing downwards.
data.rules:
1. Participant needs to shoot within a timespan of 5 seconds after making rotations.
2. Each participant gets 3 shoots.
3. The total score will b calculated after all the shots are made.

data.title: TIME LAPSE
data.desc: Time-lapse photography is a technique whereby the frequency at which film frames are captured (the frame rate) is much lower than that used to view the sequence. When played at normal speed, time appears to be moving faster and thus lapsing. Or called a fast moving video in simple language.
data.rules:
- It is an online event.
- The event will be held on www.facebook.com/jhalakcaptus.
- Likes will also be a factor for winning.
- Time-lapse should be on your college campus.

data.title: PIC OF THE DAY
data.desc: They say, a picture can convey the untold stories. It contains the emotions and chapters of life one wants to cherish lifelong. Here we bring to you 'Pic of the Day', by which we want you to capture the beauty and vivacity of our grand fest.
data.rules:
1. It is an individual event. 
2. Pictures should be clicked within the YMCA campus itself. 
3. Editing of pictures is allowed. 
4. Participants must be able to provide the original photographs to jhalakcaptus@gmail.com. 
5. Minimum resolution 5MP. 
6. All participants must be college students. 
7. Cheaters would be disqualified.

data.title: WALL SCRAWL
data.desc: Want to give your painting a chance to mesmerise people ?Want to break the stereotypical idea of painting on a piece of paper?Excited to print the walls with your ideas? Grab the chance by registering for Wall Scrawl.
data.rules:
1.	Team of 3-4 members. 
2.	There will be prelims for 1 hour.
3.	For prelims, paint colors and brushes will be provided.
4.	Theme will be provided on the spot.
5.	6 teams to be shortlisted on basis of prelims and provided with wall and sprays.
6.	3 hours will be provided for main event.
7.	Extra time will not be provided.
data.venue: Prelims - Lal Chowk & Main Event - Shakuntalam

data.title: NUKKAD NATAK
data.desc:
Nukkad Natak is a form of theatrical performance and presentation in outdoor public spaces at the top of their voices with enthusiastic and energetic music. Feel closer to your roots by submerging in the art from the past, which was lost somewhere in urbanization. Grab your dholmanjira and come back to the nukkad with the message for the masses.
Chedhenge Kuch Aise Saaz ,
Harr Gali Me Gunjegi Humari Aawaz.
Team Size: 12-25 members Time Limit: 15-20 minutes (Including setup)
data.rules:
1. Language should be Hindi. However, some words or quotes from other languages may be used.
2. The theme for the nukkad natak should reveal a social issue and should clearly illustrate the message as well.
3. Household items like utensils and instruments like dholak, drums and sticks are allowed.
4. Banners and posters are allowed.
5. No electronic media is allowed.
6. The script should be original. If found copied, it will lead to direct disqualification.
7. Judgment will be based on script, clarity, expressions, crowd interaction and teamwork.
8. Exceeding the time limit will lead to negative marking.

General Rules: 1. Participants must bring their college identity cards along with them.
2. Participants must reach the venue an hour prior to the event.
3. Any form of obscenity or inappropriate behaviour with the management, judges, organizers and crowd will result in direct disqualification.
4. The final decision regarding any matter lies in the hands of the organizers & judges, and is absolutely binding.
5. All the equipment provided by the college must be handles with proper care.

data.title: THE ULTIMATE SHOOTER
data.desc: A duo tries to shoot as many 3 pointers in a limited time to become the ultimate shooter.
data.rules:
1. Each Team gets 90 Sec to make the shots.
2. Players can shoot from 4 different spots marked on the court.
3. Players will shoot alternatively.
4. Making a shot with money ball lends extra points.
5. Team with most points wins.

data.title: AIR RAID 2.0
data.desc: 2 teams having 3 players each compete with each other to carry their flag safely to the finish point without being hit by opponent teams water balloon.
data.rules:
1. Each team consists of 3 members.
2. Players can’t change their roles in middle of the event.
3. A player can play in only one team.
4. Flag bearer needs to follow created fixed path strictly.

data.title: HUMAN X&O
data.desc: 2 teams of 3 members each compete to win a game of X&O.
data.rules: To be declared on the spot.

data.title: CATCH THEM ALL
data.desc: Catch more and more Volleyballs while keeping the previous ones in your hands.
data.rules:
1. Team consists of 2 players.
2. One teammate throws the balls from a fixed distance.
3. Catching the last ball(basketball) doubles the score.

data.title: BIG BOSS 2.0
data.desc: Big Boss is a Technical-cum-fun event that IEEE YMCA student branch is organising in Elements Culmyca’18. It will be a three day events of multiple rounds in a time slot of 2 hours per day. The participants will be grouped in teams. There will be different task that the participants will have to do. Elimination will takes place after every round. The nominated participants will participate in final technical round.
data.rules: No specific rules as such.

data.title: WALK THAT WALK
data.desc: In this event, the participants have to walk a special walk. There will be a narrow path on which the participants have to walk in such a manner that their body will not tilt. The twist is that they can’t even run. Any tilt or fast movement will switch the buzzer and make them disqualified.
data.rules: No specific rules as such.

data.title: SKIT
data.desc: A short comedy sketch or piece of humorous writing, especially a parody.
data.rules: This is a presentation event.

data.title: LYRICAL
data.desc:
Lyrical of literature, art, or music expressing the writer's emotions in an imaginative and beautiful way with combination of musical track and poetry which expresses the feeling of story.

Dikhayenge Shayri Or Sangeet Ka Sangam Kuch Aisa Khaas,
Bhar Denge Sabke Dilon Me Harsh Or Ullas.
data.rules: This is a presentation event.

data.title: MIME
data.desc:
MIME is a performance art involving the acting out a story through body motions only without any speech.
Safed Kaale Ho Kar Aayenge,
Bina Bole Sab Keh Jayenge.
data.rules:
1. Only one entry per institute will be entertained. 
2. Maximum number of eight participants are allowed to participate in this item. (Including light and music) 
3. Judgment will most likely be based on the qualities like idea, creativity of presentation, use of make-up, music and general impression.  
4. Duration of performance shall be maximum of 7 minutes.
5. Exceeding the time limit will lead to negative marking. 
6. Any kind of fluid, live animals, flame or heavy objects are not allowed.

General Rules:
 1. Participants must bring their college identity cards along with them. 
2. Participants must reach the venue an hour prior to the event. 
3. Any form of obscenity or inappropriate behaviour with the management, judges, organizers and crowd will result in direct disqualification.
 4. The final decision regarding any matter lies in the hands of the organizers & judges, and is absolutely binding. 
5. All the equipment provided by the college must be handles with proper care.

data.title: OPEN MIC
data.desc: An open mic or open mike (derived from the expression "open microphone") is a live show at institution or pub where audience members who are amateur performers or professionals who want to try out new material or plug an upcoming show are given the opportunity to perform onstage. Typically, as the name suggests, the performer is provided with a microphone which is plugged into a PA system, to make the individual's performance loud enough for the audience to hear. These events are focused on performance arts like poetry and spoken word, music (often singer-songwriters who accompany themselves on guitar), and comedy. Less commonly, small groups, such as a small rock band duo/trio or a comedy duo may appear.
data.rules: To be declared on the spot.

data.title: MONOACT
data.desc:
A monoact is a theatrical piece played by a single actor usually portraying one character.Have you ever dreamt of going up on the stage and delivering the performance of your life? Do you think that the stage is the perfect place for you to be at? Welcome to mono-acting, where narcissism is not a bad thing. The stage is all yours, the spotlight is on you and only you will be remembered for that amazing performance!  

Kai Logon Ke Sachch Btayenge
Alag Alag Tasveere Jo Dikhayenge

Team Size: Individual participation 
Time limit: 5-10 minutes (Including stage setup)
data.rules:
1. Language should be English, Hindi or both. However, some words or quotes from other languages may be used. 
2. Participants must either bring their own instruments or submit their music in pen drive (mp3 format), to the organizer, an hour prior to the event. 
3. A chair and table will be provided by Resurrection. If the participants need something else then they should bring their own props and the same must be well informed to the organizers. 
4. Judgment will be based on originality, expressions, body language, script, voice modulation and clarity
 5. Exceeding the time limit will lead to negative marking. 
6. Any kind of fluid, live animals, flame or heavy objects are not allowed.

General Rules:
 1. Participants must bring their college identity cards along with them. 
2. Participants must reach the venue an hour prior to the event. 
3. Any form of obscenity or inappropriate behaviour with the management, judges, organizers and crowd will result in direct disqualification.
 4. The final decision regarding any matter lies in the hands of the organizers & judges, and is absolutely binding. 
5. All the equipment provided by the college must be handles with proper care.

data.title: RAKZZ
data.desc:
“Oh! With the Dance, let joy be unconfined;
No sleep till morn, when soul and art meet,
To chase the glowing hours with flying feet.”

Dance is passion embodied, a realisation of being alive, being free. Life, for some, is battle; for rest it is dance. So, gear up, group yourselves with the rest of those peeps and come together for one of the most exciting and breath-taking main stage dance events - RAKZZ. From choreography to your synchronous moves, costumes to props, every little detail matters.
data.rules:
- It is a team event.
- Dance form shall be freestyle.
- There will be prelims and a final round.

PRELIMS: -
Participating teams have to send their dance video of about 5-7 minutes for the prelims.  And the finalists will be performing on the stage. You must send your videos to 'ashasingh.as63@gmail.com'
   
FINALS: -
1. Maximum time allowed for the performance is 9+6 minutes. Teams exceeding this time will be penalised. 
2. A minimum of 6 members must be on stage at any time during the performance. 
3. There is restriction on the use of fire or any inflammable object and glass shatter on stage. Negative points may be awarded in such a case. 
4. The teams should restore the stage to its previous condition after their performance.
5. Teams can consist of a maximum of 40 members.
6. The teams must bring pendrive/CD for the music track (MP3 audio format).

data.title: FOLKLORE
data.desc:
"To all the Folks out there, let your folks know how well can you Folk Dance."

Dance till you drop! Rock the floor with your ecstatic dance mix of intensity, energy and enthusiasm. Let your feet speak the hidden language of your soul. Let the rhythm carry you away where the hand goes. So, here’s a chance to mesmerize the audience with your energy.
Folklore is a folk-dance event which reflects our culture. Here begins a celebration recited through dance, colours, music and stories. Join us, live a culture and share one.
data.rules:
1. Each team may not exceed more than 40 members. 
2. Maximum time allowed for the performance is 8+6 minutes. Teams exceeding this time will be penalized. 
3. A minimum of 6 members must be on stage at any time during the performance. 
4. There is restriction on the use of fire or any inflammable object and glass shatter on stage. Negative points may be awarded in such a case. 
5. The teams should restore the stage to its previous condition after their performance. 
6. The teams must bring pendrives/CD for the music track (MP3 audio format).

data.title: TWIST TAMBOLA
data.desc: As the name suggest the event will be Twisted Tambola. In this Tambola game will be played but with a twist. There exists a question for each number. The answer to that question will have to be marked on the Tambola Slip. The one whose slip will be marked first, will be the winner.
data.rules:
1. The participants have to participate in a group of two.
2. Mobiles phones and calculators are not allowed.

data.title: FLASHBACK
data.desc:
Dhak ki tiki, Dhak ki tiki, Dhak ki tiki.. Dhaa!!

Not letting you forget the evergreen rhythms of the 80s and 90s, to make you groove on the songs of the time of "Akhiyon se goli maare" and "Tu cheez badi hai mast mast", we bring you FLASHBACK, our group dance event that makes you hop on your seats and urges you to come on the stage and join the crazy dance on board! Kicking the technicalities far away, If you're looking for a fun Bollywood dance that leaves you craving for more, it is the place to be! 
As the name suggest, FLASHBACK takes you to a trip to that era of rock and roll music which you don't want to miss!
data.rules: It is a presentation event.

data.title: FOOTLOOSE
data.desc:
“Agar koi music feel kar sakta hai, then Anybody Can Dance!”

The beauty of dance is the opportunity to highlight your greatest strengths as a dancer, to reveal a character's story which people only dared to imagine, to be the story teller where the audience watches your body tell a story. FOOTLOOSE invites you to come showcase your talent as the audience watches in awe how you turn imagination into reality.
So you think that you are the boss? You can be a slave to the rhythm? Come on then. Dance on the spot for twisted and surprising music tracks.
data.rules:
1. Only solo entries allowed. 
2. Participants must perform for 2+1 minutes. 
3. Music played would be randomly chosen by the event organizers. 
4. Participants must match the music type and adapt accordingly. 
5. Participants would be judged based on their skill to adapt, presence of mind, stage presence and confidence. 
6. Restriction on the use of vulgar, abusive and improper actions. In case of conflict, judge’s decision would be considered final

data.title: FACE OFF
data.desc:
Its shake your booty time!

If you have got the moves that can make the music groove along, come forth and shake on the beats. Unleash the free spirited dancer within you because a positive instinct has got all it takes. Befriend spontaneity, let your entropy shoot up and make the best of your crazy dancing time.
data.rules:
Judging parameters:
• Facial expressions and body language
• Footwork and hand movements
• Presentation
• Choreography (technical perfection)
• Stage presence

Prelims -
• A group of four participants will be formed randomly and they will have to dance on random music that will be played on the spot.
• Best out of those participants from each group will be finalized for the final round.

Finals -
• Groups of four participants will be formed randomly from the finalists and they will have to dance on random music that will be played on the spot.
• Instant choreographic skills and synchronization to music will fetch more points.

data.title: JUNKYARD WAR
data.desc: It’s a Tech-Fun event in which the participants have to assemble a CPU of a computer in the minimum time. It will be a competition between two participants. The participants will selected randomly by us. The participant will least time taken will be winner of this event.
data.rules: 1. Use of internet is not allowed.

data.title: TECHGEEK
data.desc: It’s a general quiz whose questions revolve around the latest technology and scientific terms.
data.rules:
1. The participants will have to participate in a group of two.
2. Use of internet will be not allowed.

data.title: SHOE DESIGNING
data.desc: A man is judged by a shoe he wears. Show the world what you got up in your sleeves by designing your ideas on a shoe.
data.rules:
1.	Team of 2 members only. 
2.	There will be prelims for 1 hour.
3.	For prelims, paint colors and brushes will be provided.
4.	Theme will be provided on the spot.
5.	10 teams to be shortlisted on basis of prelims and provided with shoes and acrylic colors.
6.	3 hours will be provided for submission.
7.	Extra time will not be provided.

data.title: TATTOO MAKING
data.desc: Tattoos make statements that need to be made. Is fashion your passion? Ink your tattoos with a wide range of colours.
data.rules:
1. Team of 2 members only.
2. There will be no prelims.
3. 3 hours will be provided for submission.
4. Paints and brushes will be provided.
5. Open theme.

data.title: DOODLING
data.desc: Too many ideas colliding in your mind. Can't decide what to do? Combine them into a wonderful doodle art and the prize is for you.
data.rules:
1.	Online platform will be provided to showcase your doodle art.
2.	Mail us at ymcasrijan@gmail.com in any form.
3.	Entries before due date will be accepted.

data.title: MADHUBANI ART
data.desc: Living on a land of diversity, are you a passionate lover of simplicity in diversity? Want to give a tribute to ancient history Make way for your prize by sending your entries.
data.rules:
1.	Online platform will be provided to showcase your Madhubani art.
2.	Mail us at ymcasrijan@gmail.com in any form.
3.	Entries before due date will be accepted.

data.title: BOOKMARK DESIGNING
data.desc: Sick of being called a nerd? Exhibit your artistic side by devising your idea and contriving it as a bookmark.
data.rules:
1.	 Online platform will be provided to showcase your idea for bookmark.
2.	Mail us at ymcasrijan@gmail.com in any form.
3.	Entries before due date only be accepted.

data.title: GUIDE 'N' DRAW
data.desc: Test how strong your friendship is by playing this thrilling  guide and draw  game, full of zeal and enthusiasm.
data.rules:
1.	Team of 2 members only.
2.	One will be blinded and other will dictate the path.
3.	Marker and white board will be provided.

data.title: PICTIONARY
data.desc: A fan of dumb charades? Want to play it with a new twist? Here is the place for you.
data.rules:
1.	Team of 2 members only.
2.	One member will be given a movie title and need to be described to another member with the help of marker and white board.

data.title: KALAM KO SALAAM
data.desc: A tribute to the man who woke up the country. To the man who was a teacher until the very end. See the inspirational life of the People's President and know his message. Be there, believe me, you would not want to miss it. See you there.
data.rules: This is a presentation event.

data.title: YMCAGIRI (ZUMBA)
data.desc: Dance your heart out in the fun frenzy where nobody’s watching cause everybody is dancing. Friends, faculty, and family all are on the same side. Be the part of the havoc and start the CULMYCA with a bang. See you there.
data.rules: This is a presentation event.

data.title: CATCH ME IF YOU CAN
data.desc: Taking your enthusiasm to cloud nine. Be ready to use your nerve and knowledge for a ride around YMCA Campus while picking up points.
data.rules: Rules will be told on the spot.

data.title: DOT - DAY OF TARANNUM
data.desc:
Love bollywood masti! Here we are to the rescue with some related puzzles and quizzes. Juggle some jumbled words and unravel a melody, a song. It doesn't matter whether you sing it or not, all you need are the wits to untangle the puzzle and an eye of a music lover!
So join the DOTs, mark your dates, and spend a day with us, at Tarannum ;)
data.rules:
1. It may consist of individual/team.
2. It includes certain fun events to choose from.

data.title: GROUP SONG
data.desc: Happiness is singing in a choir. We at Culmyca'18, present you a performance with harmonised and pitch perfect songs that will surely revive your spirits. So get ready for a unique blend of western and classical music!
data.rules: This is a presentation event.

data.title: WOODSTOCK
data.desc: On the night of the April Dip, get ready to rock to the best and the brightest bands.  Head bang or head home!! The hospice for all the musicians, the dream of every college-based rock-a-holic, most awaited music gig Woodstock, Battle of Bands is here. Get ready for a massive sonic experience with varied genres. So brace yourself for a battle, for the greatest of glories. Come forward and be a part of it. Rock n roll mofos.
data.rules:
- Team must contain 5-10 members
- No pre-recorded tracks
- 20 minutes including sound check
- Only standard drum kit will be provided
- Language no bar
- Extra marks for original composition

data.title: WEIS
data.desc:
WESTERN EASTERN INSTRUMENT SOLO
If music is your passion, then we have the stage! Get your musical skills tested in our Western, Eastern and Instrument Solos.! May the best singer win! ;)
data.rules:
- Maximum 3 members
- Time allowed would be 6 minutes
- No pre-recorded karaoke tracks
- Maximum 3 instruments allowed
- Drums kit would be provided

data.title: QAWWALI
data.desc: Qawwali-a sufi devotional music-an elaborate verbal code sung to the beat of the dholak, reflecting regional styles and languages. Make sure you witness this musical ecstasy.
data.rules: This is a presentation event.

data.title: SECRET SET
data.desc: A live and melodious acoustic performance by the group of students delivering an extravagant soulful and funky piece of music. It's time to ROCK!
data.rules: This is a presentation event.

data.title: DROP THE GEAR 'N' STEER
data.desc: An interactive and immersive simulation to enable the users to experience sensations that are even more realistic than with a controller/keyboard and to provide them with a device that will hone their racing performance.
data.rules:
- The track would be chosen by the contender.
- Fastest lap without (or less) damaged car will be considered.
- For another run ,the contender will have to participate again.
- Judges decision will be final.
- Any damage to the simulation equipment will be fined heavily.

data.title: BURNOUT PIT CREW
data.desc: Ever wanted to experience the thrill and feel that is experienced by the pit crew, here we have come with an idea that would fulfil your wish, become a crew member!!
data.rules:
- No of member for a team will be decided by the judge.
- Fastest time for the task will be considered .
- Compulsory to wear the mechanic suits and safety glasses.
- Judges decision will be final.
- Please handle the equipment carefully.

data.title: AUTOSPARX
data.desc: Unvielling the all new and better Supra 2018 Car . A fun event can be related as a social media contest.
data.rules: The one with the greatest number of likes will be given merchandises and a shout-out on the SUPRA Facebook and Instagram page.

data.title: BOT FUTBOL
data.desc:
Ever thought about playing soccer with your creation and no physical exertion. Do you think you have an ability to fuse technology with sports ? So get ready for the challenge and make your own bots to compete in the soccer world.

Problem Statement : Fabricate a manually controlled robot capable of playing football.
data.rules:
Maximum number of members in one team: 4.
Maximum size : 35x35x25 cm.     
Power supply :- The voltage at any point in the bot should not be more than 24 volts. Internal combustion engines are not allowed. 
Organisers will provide 230 V AC supply.
Control : Wired or wireless. For wired control, length of wire should be at least 10 m and for wireless control, the remote should have dual frequency.
General rules : The bot should not damage the arena.
Points will be deducted in any such case. Winner will be declared on knockout basis. 
- Decision of judges will be final.

Note : There should not be any mechanism of trapping the ball. And the kicking mechanism employed should be well within the bot specifications.

data.title: TECHCHEF
data.desc:
Do you call yourself a techie? Here is a chance to enhance your knowledge and storm your brain. Not good at cooking ? Well, if you are a crazy electronic freak, components are your vegetables, breadboard is your base . Techchef presents you an event where you have to apply your basic knowledge and make a circuit with the given components. Do register yourself now and surely give it a try.

Round 1 :It will be electronics questionnaire round. 
Round 2:Case Study of an electronic problem statement.
Round 3:PCB Designing Round.
data.rules:
1. Task will be performed individually. 
2. Accuracy in work will be given highest priviledge. 
3. Time constraints will be there.
4. Use of internet will lead to immediate disqualification.
5. Candidate getting maximum points will b the winner.
6. Candidate should not carry any electronic equipment with themselves.
7. Top 3 Winners will be awarded.

data.title: CATCH'EM ALL
data.desc: Ever dreamt of raining balls from the sky, colourful shinnying balls? Well here is a catch you have got to catch them all. This tricky game holds you prizes for your bot operating skills. Come along with your friends to catch your ball. For you gotta catch'em to win them.
data.rules:
General :
1. Scores will be counted as per the no of balls collected by bot in fixed duration
2. Two attempts will be provided to the participant maximum of two scores will be considered .
3. Only one chance is provided to pick a particular ball . 
4. Any attempt to catch the same ball in second attempt will be considered as a foul . 
5. The bot should  not  cross the boundary line which will be marked at the end of ramp (path from with balls will flow).
6. The team can have maximum of 4 members.

BOT SPECIFICATIONS :
1. The  manually  controlled  bot  must  fit  in  a  cube  of  25x25x25  cc.
2. No kind of  AC  power supply  will  be  provided  at  the  event. 
3. Each team is allowed  to  have  only  one  bot. 
4. The  catching  area  of the  bot  must  be  a  hole  of  diameter  5  cm only.  There  must  not  be  any addition (like a v-funnel etc.) to the hole."

data.title: DEADLIFT
data.desc:
Does the world of robotics interest you? A robot which carries load, collects and overcomes all the hurdles, just like a superhero, is what dead lift is all about. Kindly mark your presence at this event because the world of technology awaits you.

CHALLENGE:
" More speed , more power with minimum time"
data.rules:
Robo-specification:
* Maximum dimensions of bot can be 25×25×25cm.
* Maximum weight can be 4kg.
* Power supply will be provided.

General Rules :
1. Each team can have maximum of  4 members.Students from different institutes can form a team.
2. Robot should be as per the given specifications and it should not damage the arena or to other team's bots during the match in any manner.
3. The competition is based on a time trail system.The bot taking the minimum time will be considered as winner.
4. Two hand touches are allowed for the teams bringing their own bot with no penalty otherwise it is allowed with a penalty of 10 seconds.For each hand touch , penalty time will be added further to overall time taken by the bot for completion of track.
5. Not all hurdles you can skip, only specific hurdles you can skip during the race.
6. If the block falls in between , then bot have to restart.
7. If the bot crosses the boundary by one wheel, penalty of 5 seconds is added and if the bot crosses the boundary by 2 wheels , penalty of 10 seconds will be added to the total time.

data.title: MASTERMIND
data.desc: It is time to play your master stroke and leave everyone bewildered. All you need to do is ace the game with your lightening fast speed, versatility and technical knowledge. So, are you ready to leave everyone in an awe with your skills??
data.rules:
1. The maximum number of members in each team will be 4. Candidates from different institutes can make a team.
2. There will be three rounds. Rounds will be declared at the moment.
3. Use of internet is strictly prohibited.
4. The team getting maximum points at the end of all rounds will be declared as winner.
5. Top three teams will be awarded with exciting prizes.

data.title: GRAND PRIXX
data.desc:
Gear up to experience a challenging robot race where you will race your own robots, crossing the hurdles, overcoming the obstacles and going up and down over the planks! A competitive robo racing challenge awaits you.
In this a team of 3 members have to design a racing bot to run on a track consisting of some hurdles and obstructions. Total time taken by bot to complete the track and total score of team is calculated and recorded. The team which completes the given track in minimum time will win. The event has 2 rounds.

Scoring criteria (Round 1) :-
1. In first round, wired and wireless bot have same scoring criteria.
2. There are total 8 hurdles and after crossing each hurdle 10 points will be awarded.
3. For skipping any hurdle, there is a penalty of 5 points. A team can skip maximum of 4 hurdles.
4. For any human intervention, there is a penalty of 3 points.
5. The team has to finish the race within 3 minutes.
6. If any team has completed the race before the time limit then the remaining time (in seconds) is added to the total score of teams.
7. If any team is not able to complete the race within the time limit, they can extend their limit by 20 seconds but corresponding points will be cut off from their scores.
8. The team which still could not complete the race within 200 seconds (3 minutes+20 seconds) will directly be disqualified.

Scoring criteria (Round 2):-
1. Wired and wireless bots have a little difference in scoring criteria.
2. For Wired bot, the overall score achieved is multiplied by the factor of 1.3
For wireless bot, the overall score achieved is multiplied by the factor of 1.5
3. There are mainly 6 technical hurdles and 3 non-technical hurdles within racing track.
4. For crossing each technical hurdle by the bot, 10 points will be awarded.
For crossing each non-technical hurdle by the bot, 7 points will be awarded.
5. Team can skip a maximum of 3 hurdles out of all hurdles in a run.
6. Skipping of technical hurdles leads to penalty of 5 points and skipping of non-technical hurdles leads to penalty of 3 points.
7. Total time given to participant team is maximum 6 minutes.
8. If any team has complete the race before the time limit then the remaining time (in seconds) is added to the total score of teams.
9. If any team is not able to complete the race within the time limit, they can extend their limit by 30 seconds but corresponding points will be cut off from their scores.
10. The team which still could not complete the race within 390 seconds ( 6 minutes+ 30 seconds) will be directly disqualified.
11. There is a penalty of 3 points for any human interventions introduced in race.
12. If the wireless connection breaks down within the race then time will not be paused, so teams have to design their bot with keeping in mind that condition.
data.rules:
1. Each team should have maximum of 3 team members.
2. All team members must be of same institute.
3. Participants have to design their own bot for participation. However they can design their bot as Wired or Wireless.
4. For wired bot , they have to bring their own power supply and the length of wires should be as long as it must not tangle within complete run.
5. For wireless bot, team should on board power supply and a dual frequency remote.
6. Voltage difference between any two terminals or path is not to be greater than 12 V.
7. For wired bot, the weight of bot must not be greater than 1 kg.
8. For wireless bot, the weight of bot must not be greater than 1.5 kg including weight of batteries.
9. The bot designed by the team should be equal to or less than 25*25*25 cm.
10. Any human intervention leads to penalty in scoring criteria.
11. Any type of damage to track by bot or participant leads to direct disqualify.
12. Decisions of judges and coordinators are final in every manner.

data.title: TUG O BOT
data.desc:
We have always enjoyed playing tug of war with our friends. Ever heard about tug of bots? A game where you replace humans by robots! It sounds really enthralling! This event aims to conduct a tug of war between two robots.
Tug of bots is a type of technical event which will be organised in Elements Culmyca’18. In this event, each team will have to form their team and will have to design a bot whether wired or wireless. The robots will face each other on a pre-designed arena with a string attaching one to the other. There will be 3 rounds with increasing difficulty levels.


First round would be easy with no hurdles and is the knockout round. Second round will have some hurdles and the third and the final round will be a surprise for the participants. The score will be recorded on the run.
Winners will be selected on the basis of their scores and will be awarded with cash prizes and certificates.

ARENA -
1. The game field consists of ‘SAND’ arena having dimensions 2.5×2 metres. The thickness of sand arena will be 50-100 mm.
2. Finishing line will be provided at the end of both the sides of arena.
3. Hurdles will be uniformly distributed in the arena.

HURDLES -
- Rollers
- Cylinders (with up and down movement)
- Holes
- Surprise hurdles (not in control of the participants)

Note - Hurdles will be live for 10 to 20 seconds.

LIFELINE -
Participants will be provided with an extra switch to activate a wall. This will give a chance to the participants to have a ‘come back’ in the game if they are losing.
NOTE - This life line can be activated in any round, only once throughout the whole game.

BOT SPECIFICATIONS -
Dimensions -(25×25×25) cm with ± 5% error.
WIRED BOTS - Weight -1 kg (max.). Length of wires should be as long as it must not get entangled during the game.
WIRELESS BOTS - Weight -1.5 kg (max.) Including weight of battery. Team should on board power supply and a dual frequency remote.

ROUNDS - There will be 3 rounds -
ROUND 1 - Simple, with no hurdles (duration:-1-2 min)
ROUND 2 - switches for the above listed hurdles will be provided to the participating teams. ( Duration - 3-5 min)
ROUND 3 - SURPRISE!!!! ( Duration - 5 min)

SCORING CRITERIA- 
1st ROUND - The bot that wins within the first 1 minute will be the winner. If the time exceeds then the bot that will be able to resist more or is able to drag the other bot more will be the winner.
2nd ROUND - Scoring will be done on the basis of hurdles chosen by the participants. Taking the lifeline will also affect the final score.
3rd ROUND - !!!…..SURPRISE…!!!
data.rules:
- Each team should have maximum of 3 team members.
- Members of a team can be of same or different institutes. Members should bring their ID cards with them.
- Participants have to design their own bots for participation. However they can design their bot as wired or wireless.
- For wired bot, teams have to bring their own power supply.
- Any human intervention will lead to penalty in the scoring criteria.
- Any type of damage to arena by bot or participant will lead to disqualification.
- Decisions of judges and coordinators will be final in every manner.

RULES FOR HURDLES -
- The switches for the hurdles will be provided to the participants in the second round.
- The participant will be able to choose only a single hurdle for his/her competitor. As soon as a team chooses a hurdle, the other 2 hurdles will get deactivated for that team ; while for the other team, that hurdle would get deactivated which was chosen by the 1st team.
- Rollers will be present at all times but they’ll get activated only when the switch is pressed.
- Surprise hurdles will be there in the 3rd round.

data.title: BIG FACT HUNT
data.desc: Not just about being deliberate or desperate globally active, but 'Big fact hunt' is about who leads the war of knowledge and takes this rebellion of awareness to enormous stature.
data.rules:
1. Participants from outside the university are allowed. 
2. Decisions of judges will be final.
3. Team of 3 members.

data.title: ALPHAAZ
data.desc:
A fiesta for all the writers, penmen, wordsmiths and scribblers to jot down their artistry in the most emancipating way and a gateway to fathom the deep oceans of their unexplored selves.
Cash Prizes worth 3k up for grab and exciting goodies.
data.rules:
1. A topic/phrase/story line/idea will be given on the spot for which the participant has to jot down his/her piece of writing.
2. For more details, stay tuned to www.facebook.com/ymca.ananya

data.title: WITSVILLA
data.desc: "War of Words" to "Flip-Flop" through diametric facets to an "Impromptu" ad-lib, 'WITSVILLA' is here again to challenge your wits and wisdom.
data.rules:
Round 1: War of words (Group Discussion) 
Round 2: Flip Flop - A total of 2 minutes speaking time: 1 min in favour and 1 min against the topic 
Round 3: Impromptu: 1.5 minute for thinking and 1.5 minute for speaking OR a face off between two participants.

data.title: JAM
data.desc: Spruce yourself up a little more, dilate your ears a little more, withhold your rat eyes a little more, since this game of spontaneity & reflexes will leave you agape in 'Just a Minute'.
data.rules:
1. Language: English. 
‎2. INDIVIDUAL participation 
‎3. In the group of participants, one starts speaking on the topic given on the spot. 
‎4. A mistake of any kind to upset the rules of British English leads to other participants banging the table. 
‎5. The one who bangs first gets to point the flaw and continue from there on. 
‎6. The JAM master is God.
‎7. In case of any doubts, refer to the rules mentioned above.

data.title: KAAVYOSTSAV
data.desc:
Unleash the kavi in you with 'Kaavyotsav' this year. The poetic symposium 'Mushaira', the audacious 'Slam poetry' and the conventional poetry 'Poemgasm'; three forms, one stage, one love - poetry!

Cash Prizes worth 7k up for grab and exciting goodies.
data.rules:
Forms and styles - 
- Mushaira 
- Slam Poetry
- Poemgasm

1. This is a bilingual event.
2. One or a maximum of two participants are allowed in a single entry. 
3. This event shall comprise of two rounds. 
4. The speaking time will be 3 to 5 minutes per entry for both rounds. 

Round 1: Every participating individual or team(2 max) will send their poems in doc being recited in the chosen form (mushaira, slam and normal recitation) at official ID of Kaavyotsav i.e. ananyakaavyotsav17@gmail.com.

Round 2: The entries that will be shortlisted from the first round shall present their poems ( new one or the one they sent) in college.

data.title: INSURRECTION
data.desc: Passion, confidence and eloquence transform words into arguments and arguments into debates. If you think that it is better to debate than to surrender without a battle, 'Insurrection' awaits you!
data.rules:
1. It is a bilingual team event. 
2. Two participants are allowed per team. 
3. One participant will speak for the motion, and the other participant will speak against the motion. 
4. Speaking time will be 3+1. (3 minutes for putting forward your stance, and 1 minute for concluding) 
5. Topic will be released two days before the event.

 For more details about the literary and debating events in EC'18, stay tuned to www.facebook.com/ymca.ananya

data.title: AIR DRUM
data.desc:
You all might have seen a number of drum shows. But, have you ever seen drum sticks beating in air? Literally, there’s no base and we hear the drum beats! This is what is called an ‘Air Drum’.
Air drum basically provides the same joy to the drummer like normal drum sets. But, it improves one’s creativity as well as virtuosity.
data.rules: This is a presentation event.

data.title: AIR SHIP
data.desc:
What if the Culmyca' slogan flies up in the air during those three most awaited days of the year? Wouldn’t it be fascinating to our eyes? Wouldn’t it be a creative idea to  use helium balloons?
Wouldn’t it be more appealing if a technical touch is added to it? Well, our this event revolves around the same!
data.rules: This is a presentation event.

data.title: ELECTRANCE
data.desc: Have you ever seen illuminating dancers performing in the dark? Imagine, if this created beautiful patterns in the dark! Well, it would be quite attractive and innovative too! Adding more spice, what if lights on the dancer suits are synchronised with music? Definitely, it will bring spark to the dark. Electrance is a combination of dance, light and music.
data.rules: This is a presentation event.

data.title: VIRTUAL DISPLAY
data.desc:
Would you like to see the logo of the University in some unique way? Something illusive and eye-pleasing?
Here, we have our event called Virtual Display which works on the concept of propeller display.
data.rules: This is a presentation event.

data.title: TRACK STEP
data.desc:
Follow the dancing steps, step up your control, roll up your vibrations! Here we present, the first ever dancing game of YMCA with some technical touch. Follow the
steps with your partners, glimpse the imagination with patterns and rock the floor with our event: Track Step!
data.rules: This is a Fun Event.

data.title: CODEXPLOD
data.desc: A coding challenge for all the geeks out there. We promise you a diverse set of problems, ranging from breadth-first-search to greedy approach, from bit-manipulation to dynamic programming. If you have an appetite for solving problems, this challenge is definitely for you.
data.rules:
1. Each team can have maximum 2 participants.
2. Cross-college teams are allowed.
3. Total number of problems - 6
4. Total time - 3 hours
5. Use of internet resources is prohibited.
6. Judgement Criteria i) Number of problems solved ii) Total time taken iii) Plagiarism
7. No extra time shall be given to the teams reaching late.

data.title: CODE GOLF
data.desc: Like in golf where the low score wins, the fewest amount of characters "wins". While certainly, the best solution in every case is not necessarily the solution that has the fewest characters or fewest lines of code, it can be a fun way to exercise your programming muscles.
data.rules:
1. Each team can have maximum 2 participants.
2. Cross-college teams are allowed.
3. Total number of problems - 6
4. Total time - 2 hours
5. Use of internet resources is prohibited.
6. Judgement Criteria i) Number of problems solved ii) Number of characters iii) Plagiarism 
7. No extra time shall be given to the teams reaching late.

data.title: TREASURE HUNT
data.desc: Put your mind and body into action to unravel the secrets spread around the college. A team event consisting of puzzles that'll take you to places, as occurring according to the current puzzle and the first team to go through all the checkpoints WINS!
data.rules:
1. Each team shall consist of 2 members.
2. Use of mobile phones to solve the clues is permitted.
3. Adoption of wrong means(asking or telling answers to other teams, handing over the clue to another team) shall lead to immediate disqualification.
4. The team that reaches the Treasure Destination first, wins the event.
5. Volunteers are free to enquire from participants about the solution of the previous clue.
6. In case of any dispute, the decision of organisers will be considered final. 
 7. Cross-college teams are allowed.

data.title: THEMED PHOTOGRAPHY
data.desc:
Photography is an art of observation. In this event, you will be given particular themes on which you have to submit photographs.
 It will be held on www.facebook.com/jhalakcaptus
data.rules:
1. It is an online event.
2. Likes will also be a factor of winning.
3. The pictures captured should be original. EXIF file can be asked for any time.

data.title: CAPTION THIS
data.desc:
You can look at a picture for a week and never think of it again. You can also look at a picture for a second and think of it all your life. 
There are pictures which make you speechless. 
And then there are those pictures which force you to write about them.
So, here this event is all about your creative thinking! 
All you need to do is look at the picture, think about it and describe it!
data.rules:
1. It is an online event.
2. Event will held on www.facebook.com/jhalakcaptus.
3. Likes will be also be a factor for winning. 
4. The caption should not be more than 50 words.
5. The caption should be unique and creative, any kind of duplicity not allowed.

data.title: UDAAN
data.desc:
Racing Tournament of RC Air crafts and Gliders-

Time to conquer the air and rule the sky with your mightiest aircraft. Fasten your seat belts; bring on your mightiest air crafts. The mighty clash between the best racers is going to take off. Personalise your flying beasts and bring them in the ultimate race of the century. 
The annual Aero-modelling and Racing competition for college students is launched with the vision to provide unified platform for students interested in aerospace and related engineering disciplines – to demonstrate their aero-modelling expertise.
The competition provides students an opportunity to design and build their own Air crafts to participate in the Championship. Winners are determined by a combination of their report score and their flight score. The contest will provide a real world aircraft design experience for engineering students by giving them the opportunity to validate their analytic studies.

Criteria for Judgement - 
•	Exquisite Finish
•	Flight Performance
•	Sleek Design
•	Upgraded Technologies
•	Best Aero -Modelling
data.rules:
•	Maximum of 4 members in a team.
•	Members of a team may be from same college/school or different.
•	Any number of teams can participate from one college/school.
•	Professionals are not allowed. Only students can participate.

data.title: QUIZ ME UP!
data.desc:
Quiz competition is a pursuit of trivial knowledge, encourage students to achieve academic excellence and increase their awareness of the world around them. The quiz will be beneficial to those who are enthusiastic in technical field and the one who are ready to share and gain knowledge.
The quiz competition will feature the questionnaires from different aspect of technical world. 
The competition provides an opportunity to the students to widen up their knowledge and be acquainted with the information in various fields of knowledge. 
It provides a chance to realize and enhance their potentialities.
data.rules:
•	No team is allowed in this event.
•	Any kind of discrepancy may lead to disqualification from the event.
•	There will be two rounds:
1.	Written Test - It will be conducted before the Quiz as a selection procedure.
2.	Grand Finale – The Final Championship Round.

data.title: ROBO RULES
data.desc:
The competition is carried out in a tournament format: competitors bring their bots ready to battle and are pitted against their competitor bots in one-on–one matches where the aim is to push the opponent robots off the arena and scoring maximum points.
Get ready to witness the most incredible sports entertainment that the world has ever seen;
Multi-ton behemoths will swing punches, tearing steel armor panels off each other until one king of the ring is left standing, while the opponent is a heap of scrap metal.
Watch out for the bots, the builders, the flames, the sparks and all the robot guts and glory.
data.rules:
•	The bots need to clash inside the ring
•	NO RULES FURTHER!!!! ;)

data.title: DESIGNING ART
data.desc:
" Designing is thinking made visible "

You are now a real graphic designer for your firm You just got instructions from your boss to create a POSTER for an upcoming event or a LOGO for the firm. You will be given all the required information needed for the logo or poster. So bring out the graphic designer in you and show your creativity and designing skills to the world .
data.rules:
1. It is an on the spot designing competition. 
2. Team of maximum 2 members per team is allowed. 
3. Adobe Photoshop, Paint, Illustrator, GIMP, Inkscape, Blender and Corel Draw etc. can be used.
4. Theme will be disclosed on the day of the event.

data.title: LAN GAMING
data.desc: Enjoy the all time classic LAN games - Need For Speed: Most Wanted and Counter-Strike. Everyone completes the blacklist (easily), but on LAN, it's a whole new difficulty with the players as good as you. Compete and win exciting prizes.
data.rules:
1. Each team shall consist of 2 members.
2. No cheat codes are allowed and will lead to direct disqualification otherwise.
3. Other rules shall be provided on the spot.

data.title: CAN YOU RING IT?
data.desc: Participant aims different zones of a football goal post to score points by kicking a football through the rings placed in these zones.
data.rules:
1. Each participant gets 5 rounds.
2. The total score will be the sum of scores of all the shots
3. Differents zones carry different points

data.title: DUAL SHADES
data.desc: Black and white is never out of vogue.Everytime it outstands the ecstasy of colours by its charm.Paint your own world of two shades and show the true power every colour holds.
data.rules:
1. Only 2 shades can be used (any 2).
2.  There will be no prelims.
3. 3 hours will be provided for submission.
4. Charcoal sticks will be provided.
5. There will be no registration fee.
6. Theme will be provided on the spot.
